item.title: 特朗普在达沃斯演讲中坚持要求获得格陵兰岛
item.description: 美国总统希望就获取北极领土问题进行"立即"谈判。【原文：The US president wants “immediate” talks on acquiring the Arctic territory.】

item.title: 肯·格里芬称日本债券抛售是给美国的"明确警告"
item.description: 城堡基金的肯·格里芬表示，本周日本国债遭遇的抛售潮应成为对美国政界人士的"明确警告"，敦促其改善国家财政状况。【原文：Citadel’s Ken Griffin said heavy selling of Japanese government bonds this week should serve as an “explicit warning” to US politicians to improve the nation’s finances.】

item.title: 亿万富豪孙大雄的生物科技股暴涨令做空者血本无归
item.description: 生物科技亿万富翁帕特里克·孙尚雄旗下的ImmunityBio公司股价在过去三周内飙升逾三倍，迫使部分做空该股的投资者被迫止损离场。【原文：Biotech billionaire Patrick Soon-Shiong’s ImmunityBio Inc. has more than tripled over the past three weeks, forcing some short sellers that were betting against the stock to exit their positions at a loss.】

item.title: 高盛、蓝猫眼为OneStream交易筹措30亿美元私募贷款
item.description: 知情人士透露，私募股权公司Hg正与私募信贷机构洽谈一笔约30亿美元的贷款，用于资助其收购OneStream公司的交易。【原文：Buyout firm Hg is in discussions with private credit lenders for a roughly $3 billion loan to help finance its acquisition of OneStream Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国20年期国债拍卖在格陵兰岛紧张局势中测试市场需求
item.description: 长期国债在20年期国债拍卖前收复失地，此次拍卖将揭示投资者对美国在控制格陵兰问题上的强硬态度以及全球严峻财政状况的看法。【原文：Long-maturity Treasuries recouped losses ahead of an auction of 20-year bonds that stands to illuminate investor attitudes about US aggression over control of Greenland and challenging fiscal conditions globally.】

item.title: 男装仓库公司发行垃圾债券，收益率达10%，用于支付分红
item.description: 男装仓库公司已开始发行4亿美元垃圾债券，提供今年最高收益率之一。这家服装零售商正寻求资金支付股东分红，此前该公司经历了有史以来最繁忙的债务融资分红期之一。【原文：Men’s Wearhouse has begun marketing a $400 million junk bond, offering one of the highest yields of the year, as the clothing retailer seeks funds to pay owners following one of the busiest periods ever for debt-funded dividends.】

item.title: OpenAI首席财务官为ChatGPT广告辩护，称其为"强劲商业模式"
item.description: OpenAI的一位高管为公司在热门聊天机器人ChatGPT中添加广告的行为辩护，称此举旨在让更多人能够接触人工智能。【原文：One of OpenAI’s top executives defended the company’s addition of ads to its popular chatbot ChatGPT as a way to democratize access to artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 赞比亚在面临10亿美元债务墙之际取消外债上限
item.description: 赞比亚将外国投资者可购买本币债券的限额提高了四倍以上，此举可能降低债务展期风险，因今年约有11.6亿美元债务到期需偿还。【原文：Zambia has more than quadrupled the cap on local-currency bonds that foreign investors can buy, a move that may reduce rollover risk as about $1.16 billion in debt payments fall due this year.】

item.title: 热狗制造商纳森将被猪肉生产商史密斯菲尔德收购
item.description: 史密斯菲尔德食品公司宣布将以约4.5亿美元收购传奇热狗品牌纳森名店，从而获得其最大业务板块中关键产品的经营权。【原文：Smithfield Foods Inc. said it would acquire legendary hot dog brand Nathan’s Famous in a deal valued at about $450 million, securing the rights to a key product in its business’s largest segment.】

item.title: 加拿大输油管道问题再度浮现，油砂产量激增
item.description: 随着全球原油过剩压低油价，加拿大石油行业因输油管道瓶颈获得的两年喘息期可能即将结束。【原文：The Canadian oil industry’s two-year reprieve from pipeline bottlenecks may be nearing an end as global crude glut weighs on prices.】

item.title: 杰富瑞称交易员应为"意外"关税裁决进行对冲
item.description: 杰富瑞策略师表示，投资者应在最高法院就关税问题作出裁决前考虑对冲操作，因为若出现"意外裁决"——即允许特朗普政府部分最严厉的关税措施生效，将引发市场波动。【原文：Investors should consider hedging ahead of the Supreme Court’s ruling on tariffs, as “an unexpected decision” to allow some of the Trump administration’s most sweeping levies to stand would trigger volatility, according to strategists at Jefferies.】

item.title: 索尼推出售价230美元的夹式耳塞，加入日益壮大的潮流
item.description: 索尼集团公司推出了其最新款消费级入耳式耳机，采用夹扣式设计，与博世公司、联想集团旗下摩托罗拉部门以及华为技术有限公司近期推出的产品颇为相似。【原文：Sony Group Corp. introduced its latest pair of consumer earbuds, with a clip-on design that resembles recent efforts from Bose Corp., Lenovo Group Ltd.’s Motorola unit and Huawei Technologies Co.】

item.title: 南非兰特汇率飙升至三年最高水平
item.description: 南非兰特汇率升至逾三年高位，此前因特朗普总统排除动武夺取格陵兰岛的可能性，引发市场全面反弹。【原文：South Africa’s rand rose to its strongest level in more than three years, following a broad markets rally after President Donald Trump ruled out using force to take Greenland.】

item.title: 巴西法官叫停餐券改革后，Edenred股价上涨
item.description: 巴西一名法官暂停了旨在限制该国餐券运营商费用的改革后，Edenred SE的股价在巴黎上涨。【原文：Edenred SE shares rose in Paris after a judge in Brazil suspended a meal voucher reform that seeks to cap fees for operators in the country.】

item.title: 债权人指控Telesat存在"欺诈性"资产转移并提起诉讼
item.description: 陷入困境的加拿大天卫通信公司债权人起诉这家卫星运营商，要求该公司撤销其转移的资产——债权人称这些转移使最有价值的资产脱离其掌控，且违反了贷款条款。【原文：Creditors to struggling Telesat Canada sued the satellite operator, demanding the company unwind transfers they said placed the most valuable assets out of their reach and breached lending terms.】

item.title: 智利新任财政部长豪尔赫·基罗斯规划经济增长4%的路线图
item.description: 智利新任财政部长豪尔赫·基罗斯在获任后的首次公开讲话中，提出了将国家经济增长率提升至4%的计划，强调了实施重大政策变革的必要性。【原文：Chile’s incoming Finance Minister Jorge Quiroz laid out plans to lift the nation’s economic growth to 4% in his first public comments since he was named to his role, underscoring the need for significant policy changes.】

item.title: AMSA与IDC重启交易谈判，向米尔斯公司提出非约束性要约
item.description: 安赛乐米塔尔公司与南非最大的开发金融机构已重启谈判，商讨收购这家卢森堡钢铁巨头在南非的业务事宜。此前因未能吸引其他潜在买家，双方曾中断谈判。【原文：ArcelorMittal SA and South Africa’s biggest development-finance institution have resumed talks over the potential acquisition of the Luxembourg-based steel giant’s operations in the African country, after failing to lure other suitors.】

item.title: 赞比亚电力贸易商卡诺纳计划斥资1亿美元建设通往坦桑尼亚的电力线路
item.description: 赞比亚一家能源贸易商计划斥资1亿美元建设一条输电线路，连接邻国坦桑尼亚——这是两国间首条此类电力连接——旨在为寻求替代能源的铜矿提供电力支持。【原文：A Zambian energy trader plans to build a $100 million power-transmission line to neighboring Tanzania — the first such connection — to help boost electricity supplies to copper mines seeking alternative energy sources.】

item.title: 美国待售房屋数量暴跌，创疫情以来最大跌幅
item.description: 美国12月待售成屋数量出现2020年4月以来最大降幅，此前房地产市场似乎正重拾增长势头，此次下滑幅度异常显著。【原文：Pending sales of US existing homes fell in December by the most since April 2020, an unusually large drop after the housing market appeared to be gaining some momentum.】

item.title: NYSE’s Martin Sees ‘Tremendous’ IPO Activity in Coming Weeks
item.description: NYSE Group Inc. President Lynn Martin expects “tremendous” activity for initial public offerings in the coming weeks, in a widely anticipated comeback after a muted period for IPOs in the past few years.

item.title: 红迪公司将于3月起在印度销售奥兹匹克仿制药
item.description: 印度制药商雷迪博士实验室有限公司计划于3月推出诺和诺德公司Ozempic的仿制药，该药专利期届满后，该公司将成为首批在南亚国家抢占该疗法市场先机的企业之一。【原文：Indian drugmaker Dr Reddy’s Laboratories Ltd. is planning to launch a generic version of Novo Nordisk A/S’s Ozempic in March after the drug’s patent expiry, becoming one of the first firms to capture the gold rush for the therapy in the South Asian country.】

item.title: 波兰作为黄金最大买家将扩大采购规模以应对地缘政治风险
item.description: 波兰央行——全球已知最大黄金买家——正加紧购入150吨黄金，以应对地缘政治动荡加剧的局面。正是这种动荡将金价推至历史新高。【原文：Poland’s central bank, the world’s biggest reported buyer of gold, is boosting purchases by another 150 tons as it braces for more of the geopolitical instability that has driven prices to record highs.】

item.title: 英力士债券因公司即将获得新融资的消息而上涨
item.description: Ineos’s bonds rose on Wednesday as the chemicals giant is reportedly close to a deal to shore up its cash position and address a bond due in little less than a year.

item.title: 股市反弹，特朗普阐述格陵兰岛及股市问题
item.description: 在特朗普于达沃斯世界经济论坛发表演讲期间，美国股市扭转了早盘跌势。这位美国总统表示，他不希望动用过多武力来获取格陵兰岛。【原文：US equities reversed early losses during Donald Trump’s speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos when the US president said he didn’t want to use excessive force to acquire Greenland.】

item.title: 在制裁暂停后，信实工业重启俄罗斯原油采购
item.description: 知情人士透露，信实工业有限公司已订购了不受制裁的俄罗斯原油，计划于二月和三月交付。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd. has placed orders for non-sanctioned Russian crude for delivery in February and March, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 花旗预计罗马尼亚债券将延续涨势，市场关注财政赤字问题
item.description: 花旗集团和荷兰国际集团的经济学家表示，随着罗马尼亚政府致力于缩减预算赤字，且通胀率有望更接近目标水平，该国国债今年可能延续涨势。【原文：Romanian government bonds are likely to extend their advance this year as the country works to reduce the budget deficit and inflation is expected to move closer to target, according to economists at Citigroup Inc. and ING Groep NV.】

item.title: 曾宣称营收达10亿美元的电子烟公司以76,500英镑售出
item.description: 两年前曾宣称营收达10亿美元的英国电子烟公司，因多轮融资失败导致资金枯竭，最终仅以76,500英镑（约合10.2万美元）的价格被收购脱离破产管理程序。【原文：A UK vaping company that boasted of $1 billion in revenue two years ago has been bought out of administration for just £76,500 ($102,000) after multiple funding rounds failed to draw investment and cash ran dry.】

item.title: 热门债券押注因格陵兰紧张局势持续发酵而加速升温
item.description: 投资者押注去年最热门的债券交易仍具上涨空间，因持续发酵的地缘政治紧张局势与赤字担忧引发长期债券新一轮疲软。【原文：Investors are betting that one last year’s most popular bond trades has further to run as simmering geopolitical tensions and deficit worries trigger a fresh bout of weakness in long-dated debt.】

item.title: 人工智能“传染渠道”显示泡沫破裂将引发巨大经济风险
item.description: 穆迪评级指出，投资者已向引领人工智能热潮的企业注入数十亿美元资金，若估值出现急剧下跌，将对信贷市场乃至整个美国经济造成严重后果。【原文：Investors have poured billions of dollars into companies leading the artificial intelligence boom, and a sharp drop in valuations would have dire consequences for the credit market and the broader US economy, according to Moody’s Ratings.】

item.title: 德国商业银行分析师警示国债持有者面临制裁风险
item.description: 德国商业银行分析师指出，因特朗普总统对格陵兰岛的主权主张引发美欧紧张关系升级，可能加剧制裁风险，进而影响欧盟境内美国国债持有者。【原文：An escalation in US-European tensions over President Donald Trump’s claim to Greenland increases the risk of sanctions that could impact US Treasury holders in the European Union, according to a Commerzbank AG analyst.】
